rules.rule_text_en: Use ’s to show that a person/animal/organisation owns or is linked to something (Sarah’s bike, the dog’s tail).
rules.rule_text_uk: Використовуй ’s, щоб показати належність або зв’язок із людиною/твариною/організацією (Sarah’s bike тощо).
rules.rule_short_en: ’s shows possession/link with people/animals/organisations.
rules.rule_short_uk: ’s показує належність/зв’язок із людьми, тваринами, організаціями.
examples: Tom's jacket is on the chair.

rules.rule_text_en: With plural nouns ending in -s, put the apostrophe after s (my parents’ car). With irregular plurals, use ’s (children’s toys).
rules.rule_text_uk: З множиною на -s апостроф ставиться після s (parents’). З неправильними множинами — ’s (children’s).
rules.rule_short_en: Plural -s: parents’; irregular plural: children’s.
rules.rule_short_uk: Множина на -s: parents’; неправильна: children’s.

rules.rule_text_en: We often use ’s with time/amount expressions: a week’s holiday, two hours’ work, ten minutes’ walk.
rules.rule_text_uk: Часто вживаємо ’s із виразами часу/кількості: a week’s holiday, two hours’ work тощо.
rules.rule_short_en: Use ’s for time/amount: a week’s, two hours’.
rules.rule_short_uk: ’s для часу/кількості: a week’s, two hours’.
examples: It's a ten minutes' walk from here.

rules.rule_text_en: Use of with things/ideas, or when the ‘owner’ phrase is long: the roof of the house, the colour of the old sofa.
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживай of із речами/ідеями або коли «власник» — довга фраза: the roof of the house тощо.
rules.rule_short_en: Use of for things or long ‘owner’ phrases.
rules.rule_short_uk: of — для речей або довгих фраз «власника».
examples: The handle of the suitcase broke.
The end of the film was surprising.
The name of the new café is hard to spell.

rules.rule_text_en: Sometimes both patterns are possible; choose what sounds natural. With places/shops, ’s is common (the bakery’s window).
rules.rule_text_uk: Іноді можливі обидва варіанти; обирай природніший. Із місцями/крамницями часто вживають ’s (the bakery’s window).
rules.rule_short_en: Sometimes ’s or of; with places/shops, ’s is common.
rules.rule_short_uk: Іноді ’s або of; із місцями/крамницями часто ’s.
examples: The door of the garage is stuck.
The museum's entrance is on the left.

rules.rule_text_en: Use reflexive pronouns (myself/yourself/himself etc.) when the subject and object are the same person.
rules.rule_text_uk: Використовуй зворотні займенники (myself/yourself/himself тощо), коли підмет і додаток — одна й та сама особа.
rules.rule_short_en: Reflexive pronoun: subject = object.
rules.rule_short_uk: Зворотний займенник: підмет = додаток.
examples: She blamed herself for the mistake.
We introduced ourselves at the meeting.

rules.rule_text_en: Some verbs are often used reflexively (get dressed, shave, wash). We usually say: get dressed / shave (not dress yourself).
rules.rule_text_uk: Деякі дії часто описують без зворотного займенника: get dressed, shave, wash (частіше, ніж dress yourself).
rules.rule_short_en: Often: get dressed / shave (no reflexive).
rules.rule_short_uk: Часто: get dressed / shave (без зворотного).
examples: She washed and left the house.

rules.rule_text_en: Use each other / one another when A does something to B and B does it to A: They help each other.
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживай each other / one another, коли дія взаємна: A → B і B → A.
rules.rule_short_en: each other = mutually.
rules.rule_short_uk: each other = взаємно.
examples: They text each other every day.
We don't see each other often.
The twins always copy one another.

rules.rule_text_en: We can use myself/yourself etc. to emphasise the subject: I made it myself (= not someone else). Also: the manager himself.
rules.rule_text_uk: Можна вживати myself/yourself тощо для підсилення: I made it myself (= не хтось інший). Також: the manager himself.
rules.rule_short_en: myself can emphasise: I did it myself.
rules.rule_short_uk: myself підсилює: I did it myself.
examples: The president himself opened the event.

rules.rule_text_en: Use a friend of mine/yours/his etc. to mean ‘one of my/your/his friends’. Also: a picture of ours, a student of theirs.
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживай a friend of mine/yours/his тощо = «один із моїх/твоїх/його друзів». Також: a picture of ours, a student of theirs.
rules.rule_short_en: a friend of mine = one of my friends.
rules.rule_short_uk: a friend of mine = один із моїх друзів.
examples: A neighbour of ours lent us a ladder.
A colleague of mine called this morning.
That idea of yours is interesting.

rules.rule_text_en: Use my own/your own etc. to mean ‘belonging only to me/you’ or ‘not shared’: my own room, her own business.
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживай my own/your own тощо = «власний/свій», не спільний: my own room, her own business.
rules.rule_short_en: my own = my personal, not shared.
rules.rule_short_uk: my own = мій власний, не спільний.

rules.rule_text_en: On my own can mean ‘alone’ or ‘without help’, depending on context. By myself usually means ‘alone’.
rules.rule_text_uk: On my own може означати «сам/один» або «без допомоги» (залежить від контексту). By myself зазвичай = «сам/один».
rules.rule_short_en: by myself = alone; on my own = alone/without help.
rules.rule_short_uk: by myself = один; on my own = один/без допомоги.
examples: I went to the cinema by myself.
I fixed it on my own.

rules.rule_text_en: Use on your own especially for ‘without help’: I did it on my own. Use by myself to stress ‘alone’.
rules.rule_text_uk: On your own особливо для «без допомоги»: I did it on my own. By myself підкреслює «один/сам».
rules.rule_short_en: on my own = without help (often); by myself = alone.
rules.rule_short_uk: on my own = без допомоги; by myself = один/сам.
examples: He learnt Spanish on his own.
Don’t go by yourself at night.
We built the shelf on our own.

rules.rule_text_en: Use there is/are to say that something exists or is present (There is a café near here).
rules.rule_text_uk: Використовуй there is/are, щоб сказати, що щось існує/є десь (There is a café near here).
rules.rule_short_en: there is/are = something exists/is present.
rules.rule_short_uk: there is/are = щось існує/присутнє.
examples: There is a problem with the printer.
There are two buses to the centre.

rules.rule_text_en: There can be in other tenses too: there was/were, there has been, there will be, there must be, etc.
rules.rule_text_uk: There вживається і в інших часах: there was/were, there has been, there will be, there must be тощо.
rules.rule_short_en: There + other tenses: was/were, will be, has been.
rules.rule_short_uk: There + інші часи: was/were, will be, has been.
examples: There was a lot of noise last night.
There will be a meeting tomorrow.
There must have been a mistake.

rules.rule_text_en: Use it (not there) for time, weather, distance, and to talk about a situation already known: It’s late. It was windy.
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживай it (не there) для часу, погоди, відстані та відомої ситуації: It’s late. It was windy.
rules.rule_short_en: It for time/weather/distance/situation.
rules.rule_short_uk: It для часу/погоди/відстані/ситуації.
examples: It was cold on the mountain.
It’s a long way to the station.

rules.rule_text_en: Use some in affirmative sentences, and in offers/requests when we expect ‘yes’: I’d like some water. Can I have some help?
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживай some у ствердженнях, а також в пропозиціях/проханнях, коли очікуємо «так»: I’d like some water. Can I have some help?
rules.rule_short_en: some = affirmative; offers/requests expecting yes.
rules.rule_short_uk: some = ствердження; прохання/пропозиції з очікуванням «так».
examples: Can you lend me some money?

rules.rule_text_en: Use any in negative sentences: I don’t have any time. Also after hardly/without: hardly any money.
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживай any у запереченнях: I don’t have any time. Також після hardly/without: hardly any money.
rules.rule_short_en: any in negatives; also after hardly/without.
rules.rule_short_uk: any у запереченнях; також після hardly/without.

rules.rule_text_en: In questions we often use any: Do you have any questions? But we can use some if we expect ‘yes’.
rules.rule_text_uk: У питаннях часто any: Do you have any questions? Але some можливе, якщо очікуємо «так».
rules.rule_short_en: Questions: usually any; some if expecting yes.
rules.rule_short_uk: Питання: зазвичай any; some якщо очікуємо «так».
examples: Could I have some more water?

rules.rule_text_en: With someone/something/somewhere and anyone/anything/anywhere, the choice is the same: somebody in affirmatives, anybody in negatives/questions.
rules.rule_text_uk: Із someone/something/somewhere та anyone/anything/anywhere принцип той самий: somebody у ствердженнях, anybody у запереченнях/питаннях.
rules.rule_short_en: somebody/something vs anybody/anything: same rules.
rules.rule_short_uk: somebody/something vs anybody/anything: ті самі правила.
examples: Is there anything I can do?

rules.rule_text_en: Any can mean ‘it doesn’t matter which/what/who’: You can choose any seat. Call me any time.
rules.rule_text_uk: Any може означати «будь‑який/неважливо який»: You can choose any seat. Call me any time.
rules.rule_short_en: any = no matter which/when/who.
rules.rule_short_uk: any = неважливо який/коли/хто (будь‑який).
examples: You can take any book you like.
Any day is fine for me.

rules.rule_text_en: No + noun means ‘not any’: no money = not any money. We often prefer no in short answers: No, thanks.
rules.rule_text_uk: No + іменник означає «не жодного»: no money = not any money. У коротких відповідях часто no: No, thanks.
rules.rule_short_en: no + noun = not any.
rules.rule_short_uk: no + іменник = not any.

rules.rule_text_en: Use none to replace a noun: How many? None. Use none of + the/this/my etc.: none of the students.
rules.rule_text_uk: None замінює іменник: How many? None. None of + the/this/my тощо: none of the students.
rules.rule_short_en: none = not one; none of + determiner.
rules.rule_short_uk: none = жодного; none of + означення.
examples: None of the rooms were free.

rules.rule_text_en: Use nothing/nobody/no one/nowhere with a positive verb (don’t use double negatives): I saw nobody. There’s nowhere to sit.
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживай nothing/nobody/no one/nowhere з стверджувальним дієсловом (без подвійного заперечення): I saw nobody.
rules.rule_short_en: Use nobody/nothing/nowhere (no double negative).
rules.rule_short_uk: nobody/nothing/nowhere (без подвійного заперечення).

rules.rule_text_en: With none of, the verb can be singular or plural depending on the noun: None of the food was… / None of the students were…
rules.rule_text_uk: З none of дієслово може бути в одн. або мн. залежно від іменника: None of the food was… / None of the students were…
rules.rule_short_en: none of + noun: singular/plural verb depends.
rules.rule_short_uk: none of + іменник: одн./мн. залежить від іменника.
examples: None of the information was new.
None of the chairs were comfortable.

rules.rule_text_en: Use many/few with countable plurals (many books), and much/little with uncountable nouns (much water).
rules.rule_text_uk: Many/few — з лічильними у множині (many books), much/little — з нелічильними (much water).
rules.rule_short_en: many/few + countable; much/little + uncountable.
rules.rule_short_uk: many/few + лічильні; much/little + нелічильні.
examples: How many books do you have?

rules.rule_text_en: In positive sentences we often use a lot of / lots of instead of much/many: I have a lot of work.
rules.rule_text_uk: У ствердженнях часто a lot of/lots of замість much/many: I have a lot of work.
rules.rule_short_en: Positive: often a lot of, not much/many.
rules.rule_short_uk: Ствердження: часто a lot of, не much/many.
examples: We have a lot of visitors.

rules.rule_text_en: A little / a few mean ‘some’ (enough). Little / few (without a) mean ‘not much/not many’ (negative idea).
rules.rule_text_uk: A little/a few = «трохи/кілька» (досить). Little/few (без a) = «майже немає» (негативний відтінок).
rules.rule_short_en: a little/a few = some; little/few = almost none.
rules.rule_short_uk: a little/a few = трохи; little/few = майже немає.

rules.rule_text_en: Too much/many means ‘more than needed’. Too little/few means ‘not enough’.
rules.rule_text_uk: Too much/many = «занадто багато». Too little/few = «замало/недостатньо».
rules.rule_short_en: too much/many = more than needed; too little/few = not enough.
rules.rule_short_uk: too much/many = більше ніж треба; too little/few = недостатньо.

rules.rule_text_en: Plenty of means ‘more than enough’. Not much/many is common in short answers: Not much. Not many.
rules.rule_text_uk: Plenty of = «більш ніж достатньо». Not much/many часто у коротких відповідях: Not much. Not many.
rules.rule_short_en: plenty of = more than enough; not much/many for short replies.
rules.rule_short_uk: plenty of = більш ніж достатньо; not much/many у коротких відповідях.

rules.rule_text_en: All/most/some/no + noun: all cars, most people, some milk, no money. (General meaning, no 'of'.)
rules.rule_text_uk: All/most/some/no + іменник: all cars, most people, some milk, no money (загальне значення, без 'of').
rules.rule_short_en: General: all/most/some/no + noun (no of).
rules.rule_short_uk: Загально: all/most/some/no + іменник (без of).

rules.rule_text_en: Use all of / most of / some of / none of before the/this/that/my etc.: most of the people, some of my friends.
rules.rule_text_uk: All of/most of/some of/none of ставимо перед the/this/that/my тощо: most of the people, some of my friends.
rules.rule_short_en: With the/this/my etc.: use ... of.
rules.rule_short_uk: З the/this/my тощо: вживай ... of.
examples: Most of the shops are open.
Some of my friends are abroad.
All of this food is spicy.

rules.rule_text_en: With object pronouns we usually use of: all of us, some of them, most of you. (Not: all us.)
rules.rule_text_uk: З займенниками-об’єктами зазвичай of: all of us, some of them, most of you (не all us).
rules.rule_short_en: Pronouns: all of us / some of them.
rules.rule_short_uk: Займенники: all of us / some of them.
examples: Most of you know this already.

rules.rule_text_en: None of means ‘not any of’: none of the students, none of them. We can also say not all (= some are not).
rules.rule_text_uk: None of = «жоден/жодне з»: none of the students, none of them. Також not all (= не всі).
rules.rule_short_en: none of = not any of; not all = some not.
rules.rule_short_uk: none of = not any of; not all = деякі ні.
examples: None of the answers were correct.

rules.rule_text_en: Both refers to two things/people together: both cars, both of us. Verb is usually plural: Both are…
rules.rule_text_uk: Both стосується двох разом: both cars, both of us. Дієслово зазвичай у множині: Both are…
rules.rule_short_en: both = the two together; plural verb.
rules.rule_short_uk: both = обидва разом; дієслово мн.

rules.rule_text_en: Either means ‘one of two’ (it doesn’t matter which): Either day is fine. Either of the options works.
rules.rule_text_uk: Either = «один із двох» (неважливо який): Either day is fine. Either of the options works.
rules.rule_short_en: either = one of two (any one).
rules.rule_short_uk: either = один із двох (будь‑який).
examples: You can sit on either side.

rules.rule_text_en: Neither means ‘not one and not the other’: Neither answer is correct. Neither of them called.
rules.rule_text_uk: Neither = «ні той, ні інший»: Neither answer is correct. Neither of them called.
rules.rule_short_en: neither = not one nor the other.
rules.rule_short_uk: neither = ні той, ні інший.
examples: Neither of the buses was on time.

rules.rule_text_en: Either...or and neither...nor link two alternatives: Either we go now or we stay. Neither tea nor coffee for me.
rules.rule_text_uk: Either...or і neither...nor поєднують альтернативи: Either we go now or we stay. Neither tea nor coffee for me.
rules.rule_short_en: either...or / neither...nor = alternatives.
rules.rule_short_uk: either...or / neither...nor = альтернативи.
examples: Either Anna or Ben will call.
Neither rain nor wind stopped them.
We can either walk or take a taxi.

rules.rule_text_en: All + plural noun means ‘the complete number’: all students. Every + singular means ‘each one’: every student.
rules.rule_text_uk: All + множина = «усі (разом)»: all students. Every + однина = «кожен»: every student.
rules.rule_short_en: all + plural; every + singular (each one).
rules.rule_short_uk: all + множина; every + однина (кожен).
examples: Every student has an ID card.

rules.rule_text_en: Everybody/everyone/everything = every person/thing. All (of) us/them = the whole group.
rules.rule_text_uk: Everybody/everyone/everything = кожна людина/річ. All (of) us/them = уся група.
rules.rule_short_en: everybody = every person; all of us = the whole group.
rules.rule_short_uk: everybody = кожен; all of us = вся група.

rules.rule_text_en: Whole means ‘complete’: the whole day, a whole week. Compare: all day (duration) vs the whole day (complete day).
rules.rule_text_uk: Whole = «цілий/весь»: the whole day, a whole week. Порівняй: all day (тривалість) vs the whole day (цілий день).
rules.rule_short_en: whole = complete; all day vs the whole day.
rules.rule_short_uk: whole = цілий; all day vs the whole day.
examples: I stayed at home the whole day.

rules.rule_text_en: We usually say all day/night/week, but the whole morning/afternoon/evening. With of: all of the…, the whole of the…
rules.rule_text_uk: Зазвичай all day/night/week, але the whole morning/afternoon/evening. З of: all of the…, the whole of the…
rules.rule_short_en: Common patterns: all day; the whole morning; all of the…
rules.rule_short_uk: Типові: all day; the whole morning; all of the…
examples: All of the cake is gone.
